questions.question:
Let L be a set with a relation R which is transitive, anti-symmetric and reflexive and for any two elements \(a, b \in L\), let the least upper bound \(lub (a, b)\) and the greatest lower bound \(glb (a, b)\) exist. Which of the following is/are true?

(GATE CSE 1999)

questions.question:
Let \(R_1\) and \(R_1\) be two equivalence relations on a set. Consider the following assertions:
I. \(R_1 \cup R_2\) is an equivalence relation
II. \(R_1 \cap R_2\) is an equivalence relation
Which of the following is correct?

(GATE CSE 1998)
options:
B.

Assertions (i) is true but assertions (ii) is not true

C.

Assertions (ii) is true but assertions (i) is not true
questions.correct_answer:
C.

Assertions (ii) is true but assertions (i) is not true
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Let R be a symmetric and transitive relation on a set A. Then

(GATE CSE 1995)
options:
A.

R is reflexive and hence an equivalence relation

B.

R is reflexive and hence a partial order

C.

R is reflexive and hence not an equivalence relation

questions.question:
The less-than relation, \(\lt\), on reals is

(GATE CSE 1993)
options:
A.

a partial ordering since it is asymmetric and reflexive

B.

a partial ordering since it is antisymmetric and reflexive

C.

not a partial ordering because it is not asymmetric and not reflexive

D.

not a partial ordering because it is not antisymmetric and reflexive
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the following relations:

  
R1(a,b) iff (a+b) is even over the set of integers
R2(a,b) iff (a+b) is odd over the set of integers
R3(a,b) iff a.b > 0 over the set of non-zero rational numbers
R4(a,b) iff |a - b| <= 2 over the set of natural numbers
Which of the following statements is correct?

(GATE CSE 2001)
options:
A.

R1 and R2 are equivalence relations, R3 and R4 are not

B.

R1 and R3 are equivalence relations, R2 and R4 are not

C.

R1 and R4 are equivalence relations, R2 and R3 are not

D.

R1, R2, R3 and R4 are all equivalence relations
questions.correct_answer:
B.

R1 and R3 are equivalence relations, R2 and R4 are not
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow
